item.title: Complete Black Myth: Wukong Xbox Achievements List—How to Get All Gamerscore
item.content:encoded:
Black Myth: Wukong is finally poised to make a debut on Xbox, which means there are a bunch of achievements to grind towards. Here, we’ve got details of them all.

Releasing on Xbox on August 20, albeit not on the Xbox Game Pass service, it’s been a long year of waiting for the title that was previously a PlayStation console timed-exclusive, but there’s still every reason to be excited.

If you’re planning on working your way through Black Myth: Wukong to gather every achievement and secure all the Gamerscore available, we’ve got the complete list for you.

All Black Myth: Wukong Achievements

Black Myth: Wukong’s list of achievements will have you ticking off challenges of every type, though the descriptions can be rather mysterious.

Rather than provide a detailed breakdown of the task at hand, Black Myth: Wukong keeps its cards close to its chest, with all the achievements having a sort of riddle to solve. Some are easier to crack than others, and some become clearer while playing the game.

The table below has all the achievements in Black Myth: Wukong, excluding the secret achievements (more on those later).

All Black Myth: Wukong Secret Achievements

The majority of Black Myth: Wukong achievements are secret, and the description won’t show unless manually revealed. Therefore, spoilers follow here.

Unlike many other games, however, revealing the description of the secret achievements doesn’t necessarily make them spoiled, as the riddles will keep you on your toes.

The table below details all the secret achievements in Black Myth: Wukong, riddles and all.

How Many Achievements in Black Myth: Wukong?

There are a total of 81 achievements in Black Myth: Wukong, with a total of 1,000 Gamerscore to grind towards.

The long list of achievements means completing single tasks often provides just five Gamerscore, though the biggest make up for that with as much as 150 Gamerscore to secure.

Are you planning to achieve 100% completion in Black Myth: Wukong? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: Complete Gears of War: Reloaded Trophy List—How to Get All Achievements And Trophies
item.content:encoded:
Gears of War: Reloaded is right around the corner, bringing the franchise to PlayStation players for the first time, and the full achievement and trophy list is available.

Releasing August 26, with the review embargo lifting on the same date, Gears of War: Reloaded rolls the franchise back to the very beginning and will raise attention ahead of the release prequel title Gears of War: E-Day next year.

That means there’s plenty of time to achieve full completion of Gears of War: Reloaded before the next instalment releases, and we’ve got the details of every task you need to complete.

All Gears of War: Reloaded Achievements & Trophies

Unlocking all the achievements and trophies in Gears of War: Reloaded requires mastering all game modes, including completing the campaign on the highest difficulty and killing 10,000 enemies in multiplayer.

If the list below looks familiar, it’s because the achievement and trophy list is the exact same as it is in Gears of War: Ultimate Edition. While that may be disappointing for Xbox players who have done the grind before, it’s the first time for PlayStation trophy-hunters to join the fray.

How Many Achievements & Trophies in Gears of War: Reloaded?

There are 56 achievements with a total of 1,250 Gamerscore to earn on Xbox, while there are 57 trophies to hunt on PlayStation—including the illustrious Platinum trophy for 100% completion.

The collection is split with the usual mix of low-earning Gamerscore achievements and Bronze trophies, alongside higher rewards and rarer trophies. As mentioned, you’ll have to become a master of all modes.

At the very least, you’ll need to complete the game in co-op, complete the game on Insane Difficulty, and kill 10,000 enemies online. If you can tick off those three, you’ll probably be very close to full completion.

Are you disappointed that the Gears of War: Reloaded achievement and trophy list is the same as Gears of War: Ultimate Edition? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: Future Games Show at Gamescom—Start Date & Times, How to Watch, & How Long is it
item.content:encoded:
Gamescom is set to unveil a flood of news, reveals, and trailers, with Future Games Show taking a central role with a lengthy livestream, and we’ve got all the details you need.

The latter end of 2025 is shaping up to be a big one with the likes of Battlefield 6, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, and Pokémon Legends: Z-A among the big releases, though the calendar will likely be even more stacked following all the reveals at Gamescom.

Though Opening Night Live may take the majority of the headlines, plenty more will be shown at Future Games Show, so we’re providing the details so you don’t miss out.

When is Future Games Show at Gamescom?

Future Games Show at Gamescom takes place on Wednesday, August 20, the day after Opening Night Live, with a host of new reveals and news.

Gamescom itself runs until Sunday, August 24, with a host of in-person events and showcases streamed online. This includes several Future Games Show streams, though the main one is on Wednesday.

Future Games Show at Gamescom takes place at 8pm CEST, which is 11am PT. We’ve got a full breakdown of timezones below.

The showcase will start bang on time, with no countdown beyond the start time, so make sure you’re locked in ahead of time. If you do miss any announcements for one reason or another, we’ll have all the biggest news and reveals on Insider Gaming.

Check out the table below to see the start time of Future Games Show in your timezone.

How to Watch Future Games Show at Gamescom

Future Games Show at Gamescom will be available to watch directly on YouTube and Twitch, along with TikTok, and plenty of other streaming platforms.

From experience, Twitch is the best place to follow the live stream as it’s often slightly ahead of YouTube, so if you’re scrolling social media at the same time, I highly recommend watching via Twitch to avoid spoilers.

Choose whichever platform works for you, though, and keep Insider Gaming open to track all the biggest news as it breaks.

Future Games Show takes place on the ground at Gamescom in Cologne, Germany, the home of the event.

The showcase will be hosted by David Hayter, the voice of Solid Snake in the Metal Gear Solid franchise, and Maggie Robertson, the star behind Lady Dimitrescu in Resident Evil: Village.

How Long is Future Games Show at Gamescom?

The main Future Games Show stream is 90 minutes long, though it will be immediately followed by FGS Live, a 40-minute show with additional trailers and reveals.

Given the show is set to be action-packed from beginning to end, I’d advise making sure you have everything you need to lock in for over two hours so you don’t miss any of the reveals.

What are you hoping to see featured at Future Games Show at Gamescom? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: Kai Cenat Unveils Fortnite Skin & Announces Next Mafiathon
item.content:encoded:
Kai Cenat has unveiled his Fortnite Icon Series skin and announced his next Mafiathon, both of which arrive in September.

Cenat used the Las Vegas sphere to show off the first look at his Fortnite skin, alongside announcing the start date of Mafiathon 3—with both landing on the same day.

Fortnite and Cenat had already teased the reveal of the skin, which came on the eve of the latest Fortnite update that drops August 19, and big things lie ahead.

Kai Cenat Fortnite Skin Lands September 12

The Las Vegas sphere unveiling from Kai Cenat showed off the Icon Series Skin alongside what appears to be an aura emote, while his hamster, Lil Cenat, also featured—which may be a hint towards the drop of Fortnite’s leaked companion update.

Releasing September 12, the drop of Cenat’s Fortnite skin coincides with the start date of his mega Mafiathon 3 streaming event. The previous event, held in December 2024, saw the streamer reclaim the Twitch subscriber record.

Mafiathon has featured a host of special guests in the past, with the next event set to be no different, and, with the start on the same date as the Fortnite skin drop, we can expect Fortnite to feature heavily.

Cenat is the third content creator to receive an Icon Series skin in 2025, following on from Clix and Sparx in March. Other Icon Series skins released this year include baseball star Shohei Ohtani, former Tottenham captain Son Heung-Min, and the stars of Fortnite Festival seasons.

item.title: Shinobi: Art of Vengeance to Receive SEGA Villains DLC
item.content:encoded:
Shinobi: Art of Vengeance will receive DLC themed around iconic SEGA villains next year, it has been revealed, with the release date rapidly approaching.

Set to be released on August 29 on PC, PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, and Nintendo Switch, rebooting the Shinobi franchise that has lain dormant since 2011.

The initial release is not the end of the road, however, with plans to support the title moving forward with additional content, and the first DLC has been revealed.

SEGA Villains Stage to Release Early 2026

SEGA announced the SEGA Villains Stage will be released in early 2026, featuring iconic Sonic the Hedgehog villain Dr. Eggman, with two additional villains due to be announced.

Although a precise release date for the DLC was not shown, more news could be on the horizon as the release date edges closer, and the news continues SEGA’s heavy crossover content.

Sonic Racing Crossworlds, another SEGA title due to launch on September 25, has already announced that characters from Minecraft, Persona, SpongeBob SquarePants, Avatar: The Last Airbender, and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles will feature.

SEGA’s push to revive its dormant franchises, like Shinobi, after over 14 years, could bring a new audience to the title, particularly with additional crossover content.

The announcement also included details of a Speedrun challenge to celebrate the upcoming launch, with players competing to set the best completion times in Shinobi 3: Return of the Ninja Master and the demo for Shinobi: Art of Vengeance.
